author: MarketBeat
title: Deutsche Telekom (ETR:DTE) Reaches New 1-Year High - Still a Buy?
text:
Deutsche Telekom (ETR:DTE) Reaches New 1-Year High - Still a Buy? Written by MarketBeat October 17, 2024 Share Link copied to clipboard. Deutsche Telekom AG ( ETR:DTE - Get Free Report )'s share price reached a new 52-week high during trading on Thursday . The company traded as high as €28.27 ($30.73) and last traded at €28.20 ($30.65), with a volume of 4310569 shares traded. The stock had previously closed at €28.19 ($30.64). Get Deutsche Telekom alerts: Sign Up Deutsche Telekom Stock Up 0.0 %
The firm has a 50 day simple moving average of €25.97 and a two-hundred day simple moving average of €23.81. The stock has a market cap of $140.44 billion, a P/E ratio of 28.02, a P/E/G ratio of 0.78 and a beta of 0.62. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 158.99, a quick ratio of 0.57 and a current ratio of 0.99. Deutsche Telekom Company Profile ( Get Free Report )
Deutsche Telekom AG, together with its subsidiaries, provides integrated telecommunication services. The company operates through Germany, United States, Europe, Systems Solutions, Group Development, and Group Headquarters and Group Services segments. It offers fixed-network services, including voice and data communication services based on fixed-network and broadband technology; and sells terminal equipment and other hardware products, as well as services to resellers.
